contentrichtext.text: {{nihongo|'''Higashitsuno'''|東津野村|Higashitsuno-mura}} was a [[villages of Japan|village]] located in [[Takaoka District, Kōchi|Takaoka District]], [[Kōchi Prefecture]], [[Japan]]. On February 1, 2005 Higashitsuno was merged with the village of [[Hayama, Kōchi|Hayama]], also from [[Takaoka District, Kōchi|Takaoka District]], to form the new town of [[Tsuno, Kōchi|Tsuno]] and no longer exists as an independent [[municipalities of Japan|municipality]]. As of 2003, the village has an estimated [[population]] of 2,736 and a [[population density|density]] of 20.81 persons per km². The total area was 131.47 km². [[Yoshimura Torataro]] pro-imperial activist was born there in 1837. ==External links== * [http://www.town.kochi-tsuno.lg.jp/ Official website of Tsuno] {{ja icon}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Higashitsuno, Kochi}} [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Kōchi Prefecture]] {{Kochi-geo-stub}}
